Submodules

models.lin_r module

models.lin_r.lasso(X: array, y: array, lam: float)[source]

apply lasso regression (L1 regularization) on a given set of data

Parameters:

  • X – is expected in the regular design matrix format X = (1 x1 x2 …) size = n x (p+1)

  • y – measured response vector (is a row vector by default by python, but in mathematical terms, it is a column vector)

  • lam – hyperparameter lambda of lasso regression

Returns:

the lasso regression parameters

models.lin_r.lin_r(X: array, y: array)[source]

apply linear regression on a given set of data

Parameters:

  • X – is expected in the regular design matrix format X = (1 x1 x2 …) size = n x (p+1)

  • y – measured response vector (is a row vector by default by python, but in mathematical terms, it is a column vector)

Returns:

linear regression (the least squares) parameters

models.lin_r.ridge(X: array, y: array, lam: float)[source]

apply ridge regression (L2 regularization) on a given set of data

Parameters:

  • X – is expected in the regular design matrix format X = (1 x1 x2 …) size = n x (p+1)

  • y – measured response vector (is a row vector by default by python, but in mathematical terms, it is a column vector)

  • lam – hyperparameter lambda of ridge regression

Returns:

the ridge regression parameters

General model package of the project. Currently, it includes * KNN
